snippet: Two new rules issued by the Securities and Exchange Commission are only modest improvements to a process that requires substantial reform.
abstract: Editorial cautions that two rules issued by Securities and Exchange Commission to overhaul credit rating flaws that precipitated financial crisis fall short of reforms required to avert future problems; holds SEC's choice to enact incremental rather than large-scale reforms will result in the preservation of systemic conflicts and loopholes.
lead_paragraph: Two new rules issued by the Securities and Exchange Commission are only modest improvements to a process that requires substantial reform.
